result.execSummary:
The defendant Ronald Eugene Kirby Sr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay costs, fees and surcharges FORTHWITH or civil judgment.
Court sentences defendant to serve 8 days in the Milwaukee County Jail with credit for 8 days, a TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ronald Eugene Kirby Sr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Ronald Eugene Kirby in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Sentencing proceeded. Statements by parties. 
Court sentences defendant to serve 8 days in the Milwaukee County Jail with credit for 8 days, a TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.
Defendant to pay costs, fees and surcharges FORTHWITH or civil judgment.

filed:  Pretrial Incarceration Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Justice Point Violation Report received and filed: positive breathalyzer test on 05-11-2015.  Court takes no action and will address the matter on the next court date of 05-13-2015.
All previously ordered conditions of bail to remain the same.

Attorney Mark Allan Dluzak in court, defendant Ronald Eugene Kirby not in court, in custody.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court.  Bail $250.00 signature bond.
Defense requests a plea/sentencing date. Court ordered case adjourned to Branch 46.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Ronald Eugene Kirby in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Defendant Ronald Eugene Kirby in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Branch 46.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for May 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point discharge summary, received and filed.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Attorney Mark Allan Dluzak in court.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for calendar call.  The defendant having failed to appear, the court ordered a bench warrant to issue.  Court does not forfeit any bail at this time.

Defendant Ronald Eugene Kirby in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties are still working on possible negotiations in this matter.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 46. jks
  Status conference scheduled for 04-24-2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Ronald Eugene Kirby in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Defendant Ronald Eugene Kirby in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Branch 46.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
